required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sedation During Muscle Biopsy in Patients With Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
clinical_study.official_title: Sedation During Muscle Biopsy in Patients With Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy

brief_summary.textblock: This is an interventional study on Duchenne muscular dystrophy patients who will be receiving sedation for a muscle biopsy as part of another study.

primary_outcome.description: The depth of sedation was judged using the University of Michigan Sedation Scale (UMSS). The score ranges from zero, awake and alert, to four, unarousable. A score of three, deeply sedated, or more was considered to be an appropriate level of sedation for the procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart Rate Change After Dexmedetomidine Loading Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in heart rate from baseline to immediately following infusion of dexmedetomidine loading dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) Change After Dexmedetomidine Loading Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in MAP from baseline measurement to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion measured via blood pressure cuff.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygen Saturation Change After Dexmedetomidine Loading Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in oxygen saturation from baseline measurement to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: EtCO2 Change After Dexmedetomidine Loading Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in end-tidal carbon dioxide from baseline measurement to immediately post dexmedetomidine infusion.

arm_group.description: Patients receive a loading dose of dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg followed by a continuous infusion of 1 mcg/kg/hr.
Patients receive a loading dose of dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/kg followed by a continuous infusion of 0.5 mcg/kg/hr.

intervention.description: 1 mg/kg IV, additional doses of 0.5 mg/kg as needed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing a muscle biopsy for IRB11-00203.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Chairman, Dept. of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine

group.title: Dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg
group.description: Patients receive a loading dose of dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg followed by a continuous infusion of 1 mcg/kg/hr. Ketamine: 1 mg/kg IV, additional doses of 0.5 mg/kg as needed Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 mcg/kg/hr IV

group.title: Dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/kg
group.description: Patients receive a loading dose of dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/kg followed by a continuous infusion of 0.5 mcg/kg/hr. Ketamine: 1 mg/kg IV, additional doses of 0.5 mg/kg as needed Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 mcg/kg/hr IV

group.title: Dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg
group.description: Patients receive a loading dose of dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg followed by a continuous infusion of 1 mcg/kg/hr. Ketamine: 1 mg/kg IV, additional doses of 0.5 mg/kg as needed Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 mcg/kg/hr IV

group.description: Patients receive a loading dose of dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/kg followed by a continuous infusion of 0.5 mcg/kg/hr. Ketamine: 1 mg/kg IV, additional doses of 0.5 mg/kg as needed Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 mcg/kg/hr IV

outcome.title: Time to Sedation Score of 3-4
outcome.description: The depth of sedation was judged using the University of Michigan Sedation Scale (UMSS). The score ranges from zero, awake and alert, to four, unarousable. A score of three, deeply sedated, or more was considered to be an appropriate level of sedation for the procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
